original: LJUNGDAHL, Karl-Gustaf, överdirektör, Stockholm, f Lund 1/11 92 av köpm Aug L o Clara Lundberg, gm Edith von Unge. Studex Lund 11, civ.ingex KTH 14. Ing AB Elevator 15, ASEA 15—16, Stat vat.f.vk 16—39, diPtr.ass Älvkarleby kraftvk 16—17, driftch där 18—27, ch V.ås kraftvk 27—32, kraftvksdir norrl kraftvkn 32—38, överdir 38—39, vkst dir Sv ångpannefrn :as centr.org o Mell o N Sv ångpannefrn sed. 39 samt S Sy Ångpannefrn sed. 43. Led stat bränslekommiss sed. 40, v. ordfsed. 43, sakk v hdlsförh m Tyskl rör kolimp o virkesexp sed. 40, ordf IVA bostadsupp-värmn.komm sed. 41, led stat reservförr.nmd sed. 43. Styr.led AB Sv torvförädl sed. 39, AB Tekn röntgencentr sed. 42, Sv brand-skyddsfrn sed. 42. Studieres Tyskl o Schweiz 24, Frankr 27, Engl 28, Irland 28 o 29. Av trycket: Div upps i tekn ämn. RNO, RVO, LIVA.
translated: LJUNGDAHL, Karl-Gustaf, Senior Director, Stockholm, born in Lund on November 1, 1892, son of merchant August L and Clara Lundberg, married to Edith von Unge. Studied at Lund University until 1911, received a civil engineering degree from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1914. Worked as an engineer at AB Elevator from 1915 to 1916, and at ASEA from 1915 to 1916. Joined the State Water and Railway Company from 1916 to 1939, serving as a Deputy Director at Älvkarleby power plant from 1916 to 1917, and as the Operations Manager there from 1918 to 1927. Became the Manager of V.ås power plant from 1927 to 1932. Held the position of Director of Northern Power Plants from 1932 to 1938 and Senior Director from 1938 to 1939. Appointed Director of the Swedish Steam Boiler Association Central Organization and the Central and Northern Swedish Steam Boiler Association since 1939, as well as the South Swedish Steam Boiler Association from 1943. Led the State Fuel Commission from 1940, became Vice Chairman in 1943, and served as an expert in trade relations with German tube coal importers and timber exporters since 1940. Served as Chairman of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences housing heating committee since 1941, and was a member of the State Reserve Committee from 1943. Served on the Board of AB Swedish Peat Processing since 1939, AB Technical X-ray Center since 1942, and the Swedish Fire Protection Association since 1942. Studied in Germany and Switzerland in 1924, France in 1927, England in 1928, and Ireland in 1928 and 1929. Published various technical research papers. Recipient of the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO), Royal Order of Vasa (RVO), and a member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (LIVA).
